classes.name: AbstractTexture

methods.name: clamp
methods.comment:
Make texture clamp :
Set the `WRAP_S` and `WRAP_T` properties to `GL_CLAMP_TO_EDGE`.

methods.name: dispose
methods.comment: Delete all webgl objects related to this Texture.

methods.name: mirror
methods.comment:
Make texture mirror :
Set the `WRAP_S` and `WRAP_T` properties to `GL_MIRRORED_REPEAT`.

methods.name: repeat
methods.comment:
Make texture repeat :
Set the `WRAP_S` and `WRAP_T` properties to `GL_REPEAT`.

classes.name: ArrayBuffer
classes.comment: This class manages ARRAY_BUFFER type buffers.

params.name: gl
params.comment: The webgl context this ArrayBuffer belongs to

params.name: data
params.comment: The data to fill the buffer with, or the size (in bytes)

params.name: usage
params.comment: The usage hint for this buffer (`GL_STATIC_DRAW`, `GL_DYNAMIC_DRAW`, etc.)

params.name: glbuffer
params.comment: A WebGLBuffer to use instead of creating a new one

properties.name: attribs
properties.comment: The attributes declared for this buffer

properties.name: buffer
properties.comment: The webgl buffer this ArrayBuffer writes to

properties.name: byteLength
properties.comment: The length in bytes of the buffer

properties.name: gl
properties.comment: The webgl context this ArrayBuffer belongs to

properties.name: length
properties.comment: The number of vertices in the buffer data

properties.name: stride
properties.comment: The number of bytes for each vertex in this buffer

properties.name: usage
properties.comment: The usage hint for this buffer

methods.name: _computeLength
methods.comment: Compute the number of vertices in the buffer data.

methods.name: attrib
methods.comment:
Add attribute declaration for this buffer. Once the attributes declared, the buffer can be linked to
the program's attributes using [attribPointer](/api/nanogl/classes/ArrayBuffer#item-38).

params.name: name
params.comment: The name of the program's attribute

params.name: size
params.comment: The size of the attribute (`1` for a number, `2` for a vec2, etc.)

params.name: type
params.comment: The type of data (`GL_FLOAT`, `GL_SHORT`, etc.)

params.name: normalize
params.comment: Indicate if the data must be normalized

methods.name: attribPointer
methods.comment:
Link the given program attributes to this buffer. You should first declare attributes using [attrib](/api/nanogl/classes/ArrayBuffer#item-25)
before calling this method.

params.name: program
params.comment: The program to link

methods.name: bind
methods.comment: Bind the underlying webgl buffer.

methods.name: data
methods.comment: Fill the webgl buffer with the given data. You can also pass a number instead to allocate the buffer to a given size.

params.name: array
params.comment: The data to use, or a size

methods.name: dispose
methods.comment: Delete all webgl objects related to this BaseBuffer.

methods.name: draw
methods.comment: Shortcut to `gl.drawArrays`.

params.name: mode
params.comment: The type of primitive to draw (`GL_TRIANGLE`, `GL_POINTS` etc)

params.name: count
params.comment: The number of vertices to draw (the full buffer is used if omited)

params.name: offset
params.comment: The position of the first vertex to draw

methods.name: subData
methods.comment: Set part of the buffer with the given data, starting at an offset.

params.name: array
params.comment: The data to use

params.name: offset
params.comment: The offset (in bytes) where the data should start to be written

classes.name: Attachment
classes.comment: This class manages framebuffer attachments.

params.comment: The texture or renderbuffer to attach

properties.name: _isTexture
properties.comment: Whether the attachment target is a texture or not

properties.name: level
properties.comment: The mipmap level of the target texture (must be `0`)

properties.name: target
properties.comment: The target (texture or renderbuffer) of this attachment

methods.name: _attach
methods.comment:
Attach the target to the FBO.
The FBO must be explicitely bound before calling this method.

params.name: bindingPoint
params.comment: The binding point of the attachment (`GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0`, `GL_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT`, etc.)

methods.name: _detach
methods.comment:
Detach the target from the FBO.
The FBO must be explicitely bound before calling this method.

params.name: bindingPoint
params.comment: The binding point of the attachment (`GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0`, `GL_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT`, etc.)

methods.name: _resize
methods.comment: Resize the attachment target.

params.name: w
params.comment: The new width

params.name: h
params.comment: The new height

methods.name: dispose
methods.comment: Delete all webgl objects related to this Attachment.

methods.name: isTexture
methods.comment:
Getter for the `_isTexture` property.
Know whether the attachment target is a texture or not.

classes.name: Fbo
classes.comment: This class manages framebuffers and their attachments.

params.name: gl
params.comment: The webgl context this FBO belongs to

properties.name: attachments
properties.comment: The list of the bindingPoint/attachment pairs setup for this FBO

properties.name: attachmentsList
properties.comment: The list of the attachments setup for this FBO

properties.name: fbo
properties.comment: The underlying webgl framebuffer

properties.name: gl
properties.comment: The webgl context this FBO belongs to

properties.name: height
properties.comment: The height of this FBO

properties.name: width
properties.comment: The width of this FBO

methods.name: _allocate
methods.comment: Resize all attachments to the FBO size.

methods.name: attach
methods.comment:
Add an attachment to this FBO.
The FBO must be explicitely bound before calling this method.

params.name: bindingPoint
params.comment: The binding point of the attachment (`GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0`, `GL_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT`, etc.)

params.name: res
params.comment: The texture or buffer to attach

methods.name: attachColor
methods.comment:
Attach a texture to the color attachment 0 of this FBO.
The FBO must be explicitely bound before calling this method.

params.name: format
params.comment: The pixel format of the texture (`GL_RGB`, `GL_RGBA`, etc.), defaults to `GL_RGB`

params.name: type
params.comment: The pixel data type of the texture (`GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE`, `GL_FLOAT`, etc.), defaults to `GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE`

params.name: internal
params.comment: The pixel internal format of the texture, defaults to the `format` parameter value

methods.name: attachDepth
methods.comment:
Attach a renderbuffer/texture to the depth/stencil attachment of this FBO.
 The FBO must be explicitely bound before calling this method.

params.name: depth
params.comment: Add depth component or not

params.name: stencil
params.comment: Add stencil component or not

params.name: useTexture
params.comment: Use a Texture2D instead of a RenderBuffer. If true, the depth param must also be true. You also must ensure Depth Texture capability is available on your context.

methods.name: bind
methods.comment: Bind the underlying webgl framebuffer.

methods.name: clear
methods.comment: Clear all buffers (color, depth and stencil).

methods.name: defaultViewport
methods.comment: Set the webgl viewport to the size of this FBO.

methods.name: detach
methods.comment:
Remove an attachment from this FBO.
The FBO must be explicitely bound before calling this method.

params.name: bindingPoint
params.comment: The binding point of the attachment (`GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0`, `GL_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT`, etc.)

methods.name: dispose
methods.comment: Delete all webgl objects related to this FBO.

methods.name: getAttachment
methods.comment: Get a specific attachment of this FBO (if it exists).

params.name: bindingPoint
params.comment: The binding point of the attachment (`GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0`, `GL_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT`, etc.)

methods.name: getColor
methods.comment: Get the color attachment of this FBO (if it exists).

params.name: index
params.comment: The color attachment index

methods.name: getColorTexture
methods.comment: Get the color texture of this FBO (if it exists).

params.name: index
params.comment: The color attachment index

methods.name: getDepth
methods.comment: Get the depth attachment of this FBO (if it exists).

methods.name: isValid
methods.comment:
Check if the FBO is valid.
The FBO must be explicitely bound before calling this method.

methods.name: resize
methods.comment: Resize the FBO and its attachments.

params.name: w
params.comment: The new width

params.name: h
params.comment: The new height

classes.name: Program
classes.comment:
This class provides provides shader compilation and webgl program linking functionality.
It also give you convenient access to active uniforms and attributes.

constructors.name: Program
constructors.comment: You can pass optional shader code to immediatly compile shaders or compile them later with [compile](/api/nanogl/classes/Program#item-286).

params.name: gl
params.comment: The webgl context this Program belongs to

params.name: vert
params.comment: The vertex shader code

params.name: frag
params.comment: The fragment shader code

params.name: defs
params.comment: A string to prepend to both fragment and vertex shader code

properties.name: _cuid
properties.comment: Unique id for the program that updates every time it is compiled

properties.name: _uid
properties.comment: Unique id for the program

properties.name: dyns
properties.comment: The list of uniform & attribute names

properties.name: fShader
properties.comment: The underlying webgl fragment shader

properties.name: gl
properties.comment: The webgl context this Program belongs to

properties.name: program
properties.comment: The underlying webgl program

properties.name: ready
properties.comment: Whether the program is ready to use or not

properties.name: vShader
properties.comment: The underlying webgl vertex shader

properties.name: debug
properties.comment: Can be set to true to check and log compilation and linking errors

methods.name: _grabParameters
methods.comment: List all uniforms and attributes and create a helper function for each on Program instance.
methods.example:
For a uniform
```glsl
uniform vec3 uDirection;
```
it creates a method
```js
program.uDirection(1, 0, 0);
```

methods.name: bind
methods.comment: Alias for [use](/api/nanogl/classes/Program#item-282).

methods.name: compile
methods.comment:
Compile vertex and fragment shader, then link webgl program.
This method can be safely called several times.

params.name: vert
params.comment: The vertex shader code

params.name: frag
params.comment: The fragment shader code

params.name: prefix
params.comment: A string to prepend to both fragment and vertex shader code

methods.name: dispose
methods.comment: Delete all webgl objects related to this Program.

methods.name: use
methods.comment:
Bind the underlying webgl program.
Shortcut for `gl.useProgram()`.

functions.name: getTextureFiltering
functions.comment:
Compute texture filtering enum from parameters.
Will return one of the following :
- `NEAREST`
- `LINEAR`
- `NEAREST_MIPMAP_NEAREST`
- `LINEAR_MIPMAP_NEAREST`
- `NEAREST_MIPMAP_LINEAR`
- `LINEAR_MIPMAP_LINEAR`

params.name: smooth
params.comment: Use linear filtering or not

params.name: mipmap
params.comment: Enable mipmapping or not

params.name: miplinear
params.comment: Use linear mipmapping or not

functions.name: isBufferSource
functions.comment:
Know whether the value is a buffer source or not.
You can use it for values that can be either a size or a buffer source.

params.name: val
params.comment: The value to test

functions.name: isWebgl2
functions.comment: Know whether the webgl context is webgl2 or not.

params.name: context
params.comment: The webgl context to test

The number of bytes for each vertex in the buffer.

classes.name: Camera
classes.comment:
This class provides functionalities for cameras.
You can choose which type of projection to use with the lens.

params.name: lens
params.comment: The lens to use for this camera

typeParams.name: TLens
typeParams.comment: The type of lens this camera uses

properties.name: _view
properties.comment: The view matrix for this camera

properties.name: _viewProj
properties.comment: The view projection matrix for this camera

properties.name: lens
properties.comment: The lens this camera uses

methods.name: _computeWorldMatrix
methods.comment: Compute camera world matrix and update camera view matrix.

params.name: skipParents
params.comment: If true, the camera's parent's world matrix will not be computed

methods.name: getMVP
methods.comment:
Compute a model view projection matrix from a transform matrix using the camera view projection matrix, and return the result.

You can use this to convert a matrix from world space to clip space.

**Note :** This method returns a local matrix variable, so you should not store it for later use.

params.name: model
params.comment: The transform matrix to use

methods.name: modelViewMatrix
methods.comment:
Compute a model view matrix from a transform matrix using the camera view matrix.

You can use this to convert a matrix from world space to camera space.

params.name: out
params.comment: The matrix to write to

params.name: model
params.comment: The transform matrix to use

methods.name: modelViewProjectionMatrix
methods.comment:
Compute a model view projection matrix from a transform matrix using the camera view projection matrix.

You can use this to convert a matrix from world space to clip space.

params.name: out
params.comment: The matrix to write to

params.name: model
params.comment: The transform matrix to use

methods.name: unproject
methods.comment:
Reverse project a point using the camera view projection matrix.

You can use this to transform a point from screen space to world space.

params.name: out
params.comment: The matrix to write to

params.name: v
params.comment: The point's coordinates

methods.name: updateViewProjectionMatrix
methods.comment: Update camera view projection matrix.

classes.name: DefaultSemantics
classes.comment:
The default implementation of ISemantics.

It uses the following convention: POSITION = aPosition, NORMAL = aNormal, TANGENT = aTangent, TEXCOORD = aTexCoord, COLOR = aColor, JOINTS = aSkinJoints, WEIGHTS = aSkinWeights

Typically the same as getAttributeName but with a suffix _mt{index}

params.comment: Attribute semantic

params.name: index
params.comment: Index of the morph target

libs.name: nanogl-node
libs.description: Handle nested objects transform in 3D space

classes.name: Node
classes.comment:
This class represents a node in a scene graph, and supports nesting.

It provides helpers for handling objects transform in 3D space.
You can use it to set position, rotation and scale of an object, and compute the corresponding local & world matrix.

properties.name: _children
properties.comment: The list of children for this node

properties.name: _invalidM
properties.comment: Whether the local matrix is invalid or not

properties.name: _invalidW
properties.comment: Whether the world matrix is invalid or not

properties.name: _matrix
properties.comment: The local transform matrix

properties.name: _parent
properties.comment: The parent for this node

properties.name: _wmatrix
properties.comment: The world transform matrix

properties.name: _wposition
properties.comment: The world position

properties.name: position
properties.comment: The local position

properties.name: rotation
properties.comment: The local rotation

properties.name: scale
properties.comment: The local scale

setter.name: set x
setter.comment: Set node position on the X-axis.

params.name: v
params.comment: The value to set

getter.name: get x
getter.comment: Get node position on the X-axis.

setter.name: set y
setter.comment: Set node position on the Y-axis.

params.name: v
params.comment: The value to set

getter.name: get y
getter.comment: Get node position on the Y-axis.

setter.name: set z
setter.comment: Set node position on the Z-axis.

params.name: v
params.comment: The value to set

getter.name: get z
getter.comment: Get node position on the Z-axis.

methods.name: _computeWorldMatrix
methods.comment: Compute node world matrix. It also computes node's parent's world matrix (if it has been declared invalid) before computing node world matrix.

params.name: skipParents
params.comment: If true, the node's parent's world matrix will not be computed

methods.name: _hasInvalidWorldMatrix
methods.comment: Know whether the node world matrix is invalid or not. It also checks node's parent's world matrix.

params.name: skipParents
params.comment: If true, the node's parent's world matrix will not be checked

methods.name: add
methods.comment:
Add a child to the node.
If the child already has a parent, it will be removed : a node can only have one parent.

params.name: child
params.comment: The node to add as this node's child

methods.name: invalidate
methods.comment: Invalidate node local matrix and world matrix.

methods.name: lookAt
methods.comment: Rotate the node to look at target position.

params.name: tgt
params.comment: The target position to look at

methods.name: remove
methods.comment: Remove a child from the node's children.

params.name: child
params.comment: The node to remove from this node's children

methods.name: rotateX
methods.comment: Rotate node around X-axis.

params.name: rad
params.comment: The rotation angle (in radians)

methods.name: rotateY
methods.comment: Rotate node around Y-axis.

params.name: rad
params.comment: The rotation angle (in radians)

methods.name: rotateZ
methods.comment: Rotate node around Z-axis.

params.name: rad
params.comment: The rotation angle (in radians)

methods.name: setMatrix
methods.comment: Set node local transformation matrix.

params.name: m4
params.comment: The matrix to set

methods.name: setScale
methods.comment: Set node scale for all axes.

params.name: s
params.comment: The scale factor

methods.name: updateMatrix
methods.comment: Update node local matrix, if it has been declared invalid.

methods.name: updateWorldMatrix
methods.comment: Update node world matrix, if it has been declared invalid, and recursively update all children's world matrices.

params.name: skipParents
params.comment: If true, the node's parent's world matrix will not be checked or updated before updating node world matrix

functions.name: decomposeMat4
functions.comment: Retrieve position, rotation and scale from a given 4*4 matrix and store the result in the given variables.

params.name: m4
params.comment: The 4*4 matrix to decompose

params.name: p
params.comment: The position vector in which to store the result

params.name: q
params.comment: The rotation quaternion in which to store the result

params.name: s
params.comment: The scale vector in which to store the result

setter.name: set colorspace
setter.comment:
Set the colorspace of the input's value as is should be decoded.

To set the colorspace of the value we are providing,
set the colorspace property of the attached input parameter.
The input param's value will be transformed from its colorspace
to the input's colorspace in the shader.

The code will be invalidated if the value changes,
and need to be re-generated.

methods.comment: This method is not used for input params.

The sampled texture data can be accessed with the token of the sampler in the shader.

It is a global light model that handles
the light models for all lighting types.

classes.name: Uniform
classes.comment:
This class manages uniform input parameters
for shaders.

It handles the declaration of a uniform, and its colorspace.

params.name: name
params.comment: The name of the uniform param

params.name: size
params.comment: The size of the uniform param value

properties.name: _value
properties.comment: The value of the uniform

properties.name: name
properties.comment: The name of the input param

properties.name: ptype
properties.comment: The type of the input param

properties.name: size
properties.comment: The size of the input param value

properties.name: token
properties.comment:
The name of the variable created for this input param,
used to access the value in the shader code.

getter.name: get value
getter.comment: Get the current value of the uniform

setter.name: set w
setter.comment:
Set the w value of the uniform,
for vectors of size 4.

params.name: v
params.comment: The new value

getter.name: get w
getter.comment:
Get the w value of the uniform,
for vectors of size 4.

setter.name: set x
setter.comment:
Set the x value of the uniform,
for vectors of size 1, 2, 3 or 4.

params.name: v
params.comment: The new value

getter.name: get x
getter.comment:
Get the x value of the uniform,
for vectors of size 1, 2, 3 or 4.

setter.name: set y
setter.comment:
Set the y value of the uniform,
for vectors of size 2, 3 or 4.

params.name: v
params.comment: The new value

getter.name: get y
getter.comment:
Get the y value of the uniform,
for vectors of size 2, 3 or 4.

setter.name: set z
setter.comment:
Set the z value of the uniform,
for vectors of size 3 or 4.

params.name: v
params.comment: The new value

getter.name: get z
getter.comment:
Get the z value of the uniform,
for vectors of size 3 or 4.

methods.name: _genCode
methods.comment: This method is not used for input params.

methods.name: genInputCode
methods.comment:
Generate the shader code for this uniform param and
add it to the given slots in the input attached shader type.

The uniform can be accessed with the name of the input param in the shader.
The uniform value, with transformed colorspace,
can be accessed with the token of the input param in the shader.

params.name: slots
params.comment: The slots to add the code to

params.name: input
params.comment: The input this param is attached to

methods.name: set
methods.comment: Set the value of the uniform.

params.name: args
params.comment: The new value

methods.name: setup
methods.comment: Setup the given program for this uniform param.

params.name: prg
params.comment: The program to setup

methods.name: colorSpaceTransformCode
methods.comment: Generate the shader code for the colorspace transform of a uniform param variable.

params.name: from
params.comment: The colorspace the variable is in

params.name: to
params.comment: The colorspace we want to transform to

params.name: d
params.comment: The name of the variable to create for the transformed value

params.name: v
params.comment: The access to the variable to transform

The EXT_color_buffer_float webgl extension :
adds the ability to render a variety of floating point formats

The EXT_color_buffer_half_float webgl extension :
adds the ability to render to 16-bit floating-point color buffers

The OES_texture_float webgl extension :
exposes floating-point pixel types for textures

properties.comment:
The OES_texture_float_linear webgl extension :
allows linear filtering with floating-point pixel types for textures

properties.name: EXT_texture_half_float
properties.comment:
The OES_texture_half_float webgl extension :
adds texture formats with 16- and 32-bit floating-point components

properties.name: EXT_texture_half_float_linear
properties.comment:
The OES_texture_half_float_linear webgl extension :
allows linear filtering with half floating-point pixel types for textures

properties.name: RGB32F

properties.name: RGB8

List of pixel formats that have already been tested for texture allocation
to be possible or not, and the corresponding result

properties.comment:
List of pixel formats that have already been tested
to be color renderable or not, and the corresponding result

properties.name: gl
properties.comment: The webgl context this ArrayBuffer belongs to

methods.name: _testAvailable
methods.comment:
Test if texture allocation with given pixel format is possible or throws gl error.

Used by [isAvailable](/api/nanogl-pf/classes/PixelFormats#item-34)

**Important :** Using this method can change bound texture.

params.name: format
params.comment: The pixel format (`GL_RGB`, `GL_RGBA`, etc.) to test

params.name: type
params.comment: The pixel data type (`GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE`, `GL_FLOAT`, etc.) to test

params.name: internal
params.comment: The pixel internal format to test, defaults to the `format` parameter value

methods.name: _testRenderable
methods.comment:
Test if given format is color renderable or not.

Used by [isRenderable](/api/nanogl-pf/classes/PixelFormats#item-39)

**Important :** Using this method can change bound framebuffer and texture.

params.name: format
params.comment: The pixel format (`GL_RGB`, `GL_RGBA`, etc.) to test

params.name: type
params.comment: The pixel data type (`GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE`, `GL_FLOAT`, etc.) to test

params.name: internal
params.comment: The pixel internal format to test, defaults to the `format` parameter value

methods.name: dispose
methods.comment:
Release this instance and its reference in the webgl context.
Also release all extensions.

methods.name: getRenderableFormat
methods.comment:
Get the first color-renderable format from given list or null if there is none.

**Important :** Using this method can change bound framebuffer and texture.

params.name: configs
params.comment: The list of formats to test

methods.name: hasDepthTexture
methods.comment: Know whether a texture with depth pixel format can be created or not.

methods.name: isAvailable
methods.comment:
Know whether texture allocation with given pixel format is possible or throws gl error.

**Important :** Using this method can change bound texture.

params.name: format
params.comment: The pixel format (`GL_RGB`, `GL_RGBA`, etc.) to test

params.name: type
params.comment: The pixel data type (`GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE`, `GL_FLOAT`, etc.) to test

params.name: internal
params.comment: The pixel internal format to test, defaults to the `format` parameter value

methods.name: isRenderable
methods.comment:
Know whether given format is color renderable or not.

The result will be positive if an FBO to which we attach a texture that is using the given format has status `GL_FRAMEBUFFER_COMPLETE`.

**Important :** Using this method can change bound framebuffer and texture.

params.name: format
params.comment: The pixel format (`GL_RGB`, `GL_RGBA`, etc.) to test

params.name: type
params.comment: The pixel data type (`GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE`, `GL_FLOAT`, etc.) to test

params.name: internal
params.comment: The pixel internal format to test, defaults to the `format` parameter value

classes.name: ConfigStack
classes.comment: This class manages the GLConfig stack.

properties.name: _headPos
properties.comment: The position in the stack of the last "commit"

properties.name: _ptr
properties.comment: The current position in the stack

properties.name: _sets
properties.comment: The list of the bitmask set of all the configs in the stack

properties.name: _size
properties.comment: The allocated size of the stack

properties.name: _stack
properties.comment:
The values of the configs at each position in the stack.
The stack is a 2d array where each row is a config.

properties.name: _wcfg
properties.comment: The position in the stack of the last "commit"

methods.name: _grow
methods.comment: Grow the allocated size of stack.

methods.name: commit
methods.comment: Copy the current stack state to the given patch config and mark HEAD as the current position.

params.name: patch
params.comment: The config to copy to

methods.name: copyConfig
methods.comment:
Copy a row in the stack to the given config.

This will copy the row from `_stack` to the config `_dat`
and the row from `_set` to the config `_set`.

params.name: at
params.comment: The position in the stack to copy from

params.name: cfg
params.comment: The config to copy to

methods.name: flush
methods.comment: Remove all configs from the stack.

methods.name: initFromGL
methods.comment:
Setup initial config from to match the config the
given webgl context is currently in, and set the
first config of the stack to this config.

params.name: gl
params.comment: The webgl context to match

methods.name: pop
methods.comment:
Remove the last config from the stack.

If the HEAD position is ahead of the current position in the stack,
the current position config set is unioned with the removed config set.

methods.name: push
methods.comment:
Add a config to the stack.

The input config is applied to the previous config in the stack,
and the resulting config is added to the stack.
methods.example:
If the previous config in the stack is:

```js
[A, B, C, D, E, F, G] // previous row in _stack
[1, 0, 0, 1, 1, 1, 0] // previous row in _sets
```

And the input config is :

```js
[?, ?, X, D, E, ?, ?] // cfg _dat
[0, 0, 1, 1, 1, 0, 0] // cfg _set
```

Then the new config in the stack is:

```js
[A, B, X, D, E, F, G] // new row in _stack
[1, 0, 1, 1, 1, 1, 0] // new row in _sets
```

params.name: cfg
params.comment: The config to add to the stack

classes.name: GLConfig
classes.comment: This class manages configs for the webgl context.

properties.name: _dat
properties.comment: The values of the config. Each value is stored in a specific slot of the array.

properties.name: _set
properties.comment: The bitmask set of the config. It indicates which values are set.

methods.name: blendColor
methods.comment:
Set blending color for this config.

The params values should be floats between `0` and `1`.

params.name: r
params.comment: The value for the red component

params.name: g
params.comment: The value for the green component

params.name: b
params.comment: The value for the blue component

params.name: a
params.comment: The value for the alpha component

methods.name: blendEquation
methods.comment:
Set the blending equation for this config.

The possible params values are :
- `GL_FUNC_ADD`
- `GL_FUNC_SUBTRACT`
- `GL_FUNC_REVERSE_SUBTRACT`

params.name: eq
params.comment: The equation to use

methods.name: blendEquationSeparate
methods.comment:
Set the blending equation for RGB and alpha components separately for this config.

The possible params values are :
- `GL_FUNC_ADD`
- `GL_FUNC_SUBTRACT`
- `GL_FUNC_REVERSE_SUBTRACT`

params.name: rgbEq
params.comment: The equation to use for the RGB components

params.name: alphaEq
params.comment: The equation to use for the alpha component

methods.name: blendFunc
methods.comment:
Set the blending function for this config.

The possible params values are :
- `GL_ZERO`
- `GL_ONE`
- `GL_SRC_COLOR`
- `GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR`
- `GL_SRC_ALPHA`
- `GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA`
- `GL_DST_ALPHA`
- `GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_ALPHA`
- `GL_DST_COLOR`
- `GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_COLOR`
- `GL_SRC_ALPHA_SATURATE`

params.name: src
params.comment: The multiplier for the source blending factors

params.name: dst
params.comment: The multiplier for the destination blending factors

methods.name: blendFuncSeparate
methods.comment:
Set the blending function for RGB and alpha components separately for this config.

The possible params values are :
- `GL_ZERO`
- `GL_ONE`
- `GL_SRC_COLOR`
- `GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR`
- `GL_SRC_ALPHA`
- `GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA`
- `GL_DST_ALPHA`
- `GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_ALPHA`
- `GL_DST_COLOR`
- `GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_COLOR`
- `GL_SRC_ALPHA_SATURATE`

params.name: srcRgb
params.comment: The multiplier for the RGB source blending factors

params.name: dstRgb
params.comment: The multiplier for the RGB destination blending factors

params.name: srcAlpha
params.comment: The multiplier for the alpha source blending factor

params.name: dstAlpha
params.comment: The multiplier for the alpha destination blending factor

methods.name: clone
methods.comment: Returns a clone of this config.

methods.name: colorMask
methods.comment: Set which color components to enable or to disable for this config.

params.name: r
params.comment: Whether to enable the red component or not

params.name: g
params.comment: Whether to enable the green component or not

params.name: b
params.comment: Whether to enable the blue component or not

params.name: a
params.comment: Whether to enable the alpha component or not

methods.name: cullFace
methods.comment:
Set the cull face mode for this config.

The possible params values are :
- `GL_FRONT`
- `GL_BACK`
- `GL_FRONT_AND_BACK`

params.name: mode
params.comment: The mode to use

methods.name: depthFunc
methods.comment:
Set the depth function for this config.

The possible params values are :
- `GL_NEVER`
- `GL_LESS`
- `GL_EQUAL`
- `GL_LEQUAL`
- `GL_GREATER`
- `GL_NOTEQUAL`
- `GL_GEQUAL`
- `GL_ALWAYS`

params.name: func
params.comment: The depth function to use

methods.name: depthMask
methods.comment: Enable or disable writing into the depth buffer for this config.

params.name: flag
params.comment: Whether to enable the depth mask or not

methods.name: depthRange
methods.comment:
Set the depth range for this config.

The params values should be floats between `0` and `1`.

params.name: near
params.comment: The near value to use

params.name: far
params.comment: The far value to use

methods.name: enableBlend
methods.comment: Enable or disable blending for this config.

params.name: flag
params.comment: Whether to enable blending or not

methods.name: enableCullface
methods.comment: Enable or disable culling for this config.

params.name: flag
params.comment: Whether to enable culling or not

methods.name: enableDepthTest
methods.comment: Enable or disable depth testing for this config.

params.name: flag
params.comment: Whether to enable depth testing or not

methods.name: enableDither
methods.comment: Enable or disable dithering for this config.

params.name: flag
params.comment: Whether to enable dithering or not

methods.name: enablePolygonOffset
methods.comment: Enable or disable polygon offset for this config.

params.name: flag
params.comment: Whether to enable polygon offset or not

methods.name: enableScissor
methods.comment: Enable or disable the scissor test for this config.

params.name: flag
params.comment: Whether to enable the scissor test or not

methods.name: enableStencil
methods.comment: Enable or disable stencil testing for this config.

params.name: flag
params.comment: Whether to enable stencil testing or not

methods.name: fromGL
methods.comment:
Setup this config to match the config the
given webgl context is currently in.

params.name: gl
params.comment: The webgl context to match

methods.name: frontFace
methods.comment:
Set facing direction for this config.

The possible params values are :
- `GL_CW`
- `GL_CCW`

params.name: dir
params.comment: The winding orientation to use

methods.name: lineWidth
methods.comment: Set the line width of rasterized lines for this config.

params.name: w
params.comment: The width to use

methods.name: patch
methods.comment:
Apply this config to the input config.

It creates a new config that represents the difference
between the input config and this config.
If applied to a webgl context matching the input config,
the webgl context will now match this config.

params.name: cfg
params.comment: The input config to apply this config to

params.name: out
params.comment: The config to store the difference config in

methods.name: polygonOffset
methods.comment: Set the polygon offset factor & units for this config.

params.name: polyOffsetFactor
params.comment: The scale factor for the variable depth offset for each polygon

params.name: polyOffsetUnits
params.comment: The multiplier by which an implementation-specific value is multiplied with to create a constant depth offset

methods.name: scissor
methods.comment: Set the scissor box for this config.

params.name: x
params.comment: The x coordinate of the lower left corner of the scissor box

params.name: y
params.comment: The y coordinate of the lower left corner of the scissor box

params.name: w
params.comment: The width of the scissor box

params.name: h
params.comment: The height of the scissor box

methods.name: setupGL
methods.comment: Apply this config to a given webgl context.

params.name: gl
params.comment: The webgl context to apply this config to

methods.name: stencilFunc
methods.comment:
Set the stencil function for this config.

The possible func values are :
- `GL_NEVER`
- `GL_LESS`
- `GL_EQUAL`
- `GL_LEQUAL`
- `GL_GREATER`
- `GL_NOTEQUAL`
- `GL_GEQUAL`
- `GL_ALWAYS`

params.name: func
params.comment: The stencil test function to use

params.name: ref
params.comment: The reference value for the stencil test

params.name: mask
params.comment: The mask to use to `AND` the reference value and the stored stencil value when the test is done

methods.name: stencilFuncSeparate
methods.comment:
Set the stencil function separatly for the front and back stencil for this config.

The possible func values are :
- `GL_NEVER`
- `GL_LESS`
- `GL_EQUAL`
- `GL_LEQUAL`
- `GL_GREATER`
- `GL_NOTEQUAL`
- `GL_GEQUAL`
- `GL_ALWAYS`

params.name: func
params.comment: The stencil test function to use for the front stencil

params.name: ref
params.comment: The reference value for the front stencil test

params.name: mask
params.comment: The mask to use to `AND` the reference value and the stored stencil value when the test is done for the front stencil

params.name: funcback
params.comment: The stencil test function to use for the back stencil

params.name: refback
params.comment: The reference value for the back stencil test

params.name: maskback
params.comment: The mask to use to `AND` the reference value and the stored stencil value when the test is done for the back stencil

methods.name: stencilMask
methods.comment: Set the stencil mask for this config.

params.name: mask
params.comment: The bit mask to enable or disable writing in the stencil planes

methods.name: stencilMaskSeparate
methods.comment: Set the stencil mask separatly for the front and back stencil for this config.

params.name: mask
params.comment: The bit mask to enable or disable writing in the stencil planes for the front stencil

params.name: maskback
params.comment: The bit mask to enable or disable writing in the stencil planes for the back stencil

methods.name: stencilOp
methods.comment:
Set the stencil test actions for this config.

The possible params values are :
- `GL_KEEP`
- `GL_ZERO`
- `GL_REPLACE`
- `GL_INCR`
- `GL_INCR_WRAP`
- `GL_DECR`
- `GL_DECR_WRAP`
- `GL_INVERT`

params.name: sfail
params.comment: The function to use when the stencil test fails

params.name: dpfail
params.comment: The function to use when the stencil test passes, but the depth test fails

params.name: dppass
params.comment: The function to use when both the stencil test and the depth test pass

methods.name: stencilOpSeparate
methods.comment:
Set the stencil test actions separatly for the front and back stencil for this config.

The possible params values are :
- `GL_KEEP`
- `GL_ZERO`
- `GL_REPLACE`
- `GL_INCR`
- `GL_INCR_WRAP`
- `GL_DECR`
- `GL_DECR_WRAP`
- `GL_INVERT`

params.name: sfail
params.comment: The function to use when the front stencil test fails

params.name: dpfail
params.comment: The function to use when the front stencil test passes, but the depth test fails

params.name: dppass
params.comment: The function to use when both the front stencil test and the depth test pass

params.name: sfailback
params.comment: The function to use when the back stencil test fails

params.name: dpfailback
params.comment: The function to use when the back stencil test passes, but the depth test fails

params.name: dppassback
params.comment: The function to use when both the back stencil test and the depth test pass

methods.name: toDefault
methods.comment: Set this config to the default config.

methods.name: viewport
methods.comment: Set the viewport for this config.

params.name: x
params.comment: The x coordinate of the lower left corner of the viewport origin

params.name: y
params.comment: The y coordinate of the lower left corner of the viewport origin

params.name: w
params.comment: The width of the viewport

params.name: h
params.comment: The height of the viewport

methods.name: decodeHalf
methods.comment: Decode Uint16 to float32

methods.name: encodeHalf
methods.comment: Encode float32 to Uint16

classes.name: GLState
classes.comment:
This class manages the webgl state.

It is used to manage a stack of GLConfigs and apply the current state to the webgl context.

params.name: gl
params.comment: The webgl context this GLState belongs to

properties.name: _state
properties.comment: The current config

properties.name: _validCfg
properties.comment: Whether the config stack has been changed or not

properties.name: cfgStack
properties.comment: The config stack managing all GLConfigs

properties.name: gl
properties.comment: The webgl context this GLState belongs to

properties.name: _instances
properties.comment: The list of every GLState instance created, indexed by the corresponding webgl context

methods.name: apply
methods.comment: Apply the current stack state to the webgl context.

methods.name: config
methods.comment: Create a LocalConfig from this GLState.

methods.name: now
methods.comment:
Apply a config to the webgl context immediatly,
without keeping it in the stack.

params.name: cfg
params.comment: The config to apply

methods.name: pop
methods.comment: Remove the last config from the stack.

methods.name: push
methods.comment: Push a config to the stack.

params.name: cfg
params.comment: The config to push

methods.name: get
methods.comment: Create a GLState instance or return the existing one for given webgl context.

params.name: gl
params.comment: The webgl context

classes.name: LocalConfig
classes.comment:
This class manages local configs.

It can be used for configs that will be applied directly,
and not pushed to the stack.

params.name: state
params.comment: The GLState for the webgl context this config belongs to

properties.name: state
properties.comment: The GLState for the webgl context this config belongs to

methods.name: apply
methods.comment: Apply this config to the webgl context immediatly.

enumerations.name: SetsBits
enumerations.comment: The bitmask for each config set.

enumerations.name: Slots
enumerations.comment: The slot number for each config data.

classes.name: Sync
classes.comment:
This class can be used as a wrapper around a WebGLSync object, and provides a promise based completion.

It is used to synchronize activities between the GPU and the application, and is only available for WebGL2. As a fallback, the Sync will be immediately signaled if the WebGLSync object isn't available.

params.name: gl
params.comment: The webgl context this Sync belongs to

properties.name: _defer
properties.comment: The object providing the promise's resolve & reject functions

properties.name: _invalidated
properties.comment: Whether the Sync is invalidated or not. The Sync is invalidated on release.

properties.name: _pooled
properties.comment: Whether the Sync is pooled or not.

properties.name: _sync
properties.comment: The implementation of the WebGLSync object

properties.name: gl
properties.comment: The webgl context this Sync belongs to

properties.name: promise
properties.comment: The underlying promise

methods.name: auto
methods.comment: Start the pool auto resolve loop.

methods.name: resolve
methods.comment: Call [_complete](/api/nanogl-sync/classes/Sync#item-50) for every signaled Sync in the pool.

methods.name: stop
methods.comment: Stop the pool auto resolve loop.

methods.name: _complete
methods.comment: Resolve the promise and release everything related to this Sync.

methods.name: _pool
methods.comment: Pool this Sync.

methods.name: _release
methods.comment:
Release everything related to this Sync.

Used by [dispose](/api/nanogl-sync/classes/Sync#item-31) and [_complete](/api/nanogl-sync/classes/Sync#item-50).

methods.name: _unpool
methods.comment: Remove this Sync from the pool.

methods.name: clientWaitSync
methods.comment:
Shortcut to `gl.clientWaitSync`.

**Important :** The [insert](/api/nanogl-sync/classes/Sync#item-29) method must have been called before calling this method.

params.name: timeout
params.comment: The time to wait for the sync object to become signaled (in nanosec), defaults to 100ms

methods.name: dispose
methods.comment: Dispose of everything related related to this Sync.

methods.name: insert
methods.comment:
Create a WebGLSync object and insert it in the GL command stream. Then pool this Sync.

The promise will be resolved when the Sync is signaled.

methods.name: isSignaled
methods.comment: Know whether the `GL_SYNC_STATUS` is `GL_SIGNALED` or not.

methods.name: then
methods.comment: Shortcut to `this.promise.then`.

params.name: onFulfilled
params.comment: The callback to be called when the promise is fulfilled

params.name: onRejected
params.comment: The callback to be called when the promise is rejected

interfaces.name: ISyncImplementation
interfaces.comment: The implementation of a WebGLSync object.

methods.name: clientWaitSync
methods.comment: Shortcut to `gl.clientWaitSync`.

params.name: timeout
params.comment: The time to wait for the sync object to become signaled (in nanosec)

methods.name: dispose
methods.comment: Dispose of everything related to this SyncImplementation.

methods.name: isSignaled
methods.comment: Know whether the `GL_SYNC_STATUS` is `GL_SIGNALED` or not.

classes.name: Vao
classes.comment:
This class manages VAOs (Vertex Array Objects).

It is used to manage attribute pointers setup for given program and buffers, and provides a transparent fallback if VAO extension isn't available.

params.name: gl
params.comment: The webgl context this VAO belongs to

properties.name: _impl
properties.comment: The implementation of the VAO

properties.name: gl
properties.comment: The webgl context this VAO belongs to

methods.name: bind
methods.comment:
Bind the VAO.
You need to call this method *before* each draw call.

methods.name: dispose
methods.comment: Delete all webgl objects related to this VAO.

methods.name: setup
methods.comment: Initialize attrib pointer setup for given program and buffers.

params.name: prg
params.comment: The program to use

params.name: buffers
params.comment: The list of buffers containing the vertex data

params.name: indices
params.comment: The buffer containing the index data

methods.name: unbind
methods.comment:
Unbind the VAO.
You need to call this method *after* each draw call.

interfaces.name: IVaoImplementation
interfaces.comment: The implementation of a webgl VAO.

methods.name: bind
methods.comment: Bind the VAO.

methods.name: dispose
methods.comment: Delete all webgl objects related to this VAO.

methods.name: setup
methods.comment: Initialize attrib pointer setup for given program and buffers.

params.name: prg
params.comment: The program to use

params.name: buffers
params.comment: The list of buffers containing the vertex data

params.name: indices
params.comment: The buffer containing the index data

methods.name: unbind
methods.comment: Unbind the VAO.
